data.title: James D. McCaffrey
data.meta_description: Posts about Top Ten written by jamesdmccaffrey
data.text:
Dr. Fu Manchu was arguably the first fictional super-villain. He was created by author Arthur Henry Ward (1883-1959) who used the pen name Sax Rohmer. Rohmer wrote 14 Fu Manchu novels from 1913 to 1959. The Fu Manchu novels were … Continue reading →

I enjoy science fiction movies from the 1950s. Quite a few of them feature the unexpected effects of radiation. Here are ten of my favorites. 1. Them! (1954) – Mysterious deaths in the desert. It’s giant ants produced by radioactivity … Continue reading →

There are dozens of movie and TV adaptations of “A Christmas Carol” (1843) by the brilliant British author Charles Dickens (1812-1870). Some computer algorithms, such as eigenvalue extraction, are complex enough that they allow for dozens of different implementations. “A … Continue reading →

Morris Ankrum (b. Aug. 28, 1896 – d. Sept. 2, 1964) was an actor who appeared in several of my favorite science fiction movies of the 1950s. He would have been 127 years old today. Ankrum was never a lead … Continue reading →

Here are my ten favorite science fiction movies that feature fungus or mold. Most of these films aren’t very good but there are a couple of gems here. Listed in no particular order. 1. Creepshow (1982) – This is an … Continue reading →

There were a lot of science fiction movies released from 2010 to 2019. Here are my ten favorites. They’re not necessarily the best films of the decade, but they’re the ones I’d take with me if I was going on … Continue reading →

I like all kinds of music — rock, classical, popular, and so on. One Sunday morning I decided to capture short clips of ten of my favorite sappy (slow and sentimental) songs from the 1960s. Listed in no particular order. … Continue reading →

In July 2022, the current world chess champion, Magnus Carlsen, announced he would not defend his title against challenger Ian Nepomniachtchi. Nepomniachtchi had just won the challenger’s tournament. It’s widely assumed that Carlsen just wasn’t motivated because his chess skill … Continue reading →

A teratoma is a type of tumor that can contain fully developed tissues and organs, including hair, teeth, muscle, and bone. A dermoid cyst is similar — they can contain hair, teeth and toes/fingers. Here are ten science fiction movies … Continue reading →

The United Kingdom has produced a lot of very good science fiction movies. Compared to most U.S. science fiction movies, U.K. movies tend to be “understated” which can mean chatty and slow-moving, or thoughtful and plot-driven, depending on your point … Continue reading →
